Etienne Bacher
Research Blog Software Gallery CV ☰

Etienne Bacher


I am a French PhD student in the Doctoral Team Unit ACROSS at LISER, Luxembourg. I study the relationship between cross-border mobility, attitudes and political preferences.

Besides working on this topic, I also enjoy programming with R by creating Shiny apps or packages that you can find on my GitHub repo. I also write blog articles about R from time to time, that you can find in the “Blog” tab above.

If you want to contact me, the best way to do so is by email.


Interests

  • Economics

  • International migration

  • Political attitudes

  • R programming

Education

  • PhD student in Economics of Migration, 2020 - current

    LISER, Luxembourg

  • Master’s degree in Development Economics, 2018 - 2020

    University Clermont-Auvergne, France

  • Bachelor’s degree in Development Economics, 2017 - 2018

    University Clermont-Auvergne, France
